alert.note: Alert for Eastern Columbia River Gorge of Oregon; Foothills of the Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon; Foothills of the Southern Blue Mountains of Oregon; Lower Columbia Basin of Oregon; North Central Oregon (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 22 at 4:23AM PST until January 22 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THIS MORNING BELOW 3000 FEET... * WHAT...Rain with areas of freezing rain below 2000 to 3000 feet. Additional ice accumulations of a light glaze to a few hundreths of an inch through this morning. * WHERE...Portions of north central and northeast Oregon and central, south central and southeast Washington. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Very slippery sidewalks, roads and bridges are possible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Temperatures will range from 28 to 34 degrees resulting in areas of freezing rain in each zone. This will make travel dangerous due to the localized temperature variations between above freezing to below freezing along road ways resulting in localized slick conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Prepare for possible power outages. The latest road conditions can be obtained for Oregon by calling 5 1 1 or by visiting online at https://tripcheck.com, or for Washington by visiting online at https://wsdot.com/travel.
